column2: In an equilateral triangle ABC, ifAD is an altitude then 4AD 2 is equal to (a) 2BD 2 (b) BC 2 (c) 3AB 2 (d) 2DC 2
PS is the bisector of ∠ P and PQ = PR. Then ∆PRS and ∆PQS are congruent by the criterion (a) AAA (b) SAS (c) ASA (d) both (b) and (c)

In a triangle, one angle is of 90°. Then (i) The other two angles are of 45° each (ii) In remaining two angles, one angle is 90° and other is 45° (iii) Remaining two angles are complementary In the given option(s) which is true? (a) (i) only (b) (ii) only (c) (iii) only (d) (i) and (ii)
